intro: Pyrus veszpremensis, commonly known as the Veszprém pear, is a rare and ancient species of pear native to Hungary. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-green fruits with a slightly rough texture. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial shade. It is known for its ornamental value, with attractive, serrated leaves and a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
